017
018package com.scivicslab.actoriac;
019
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.nio.file.Path;
022import java.util.logging.Level;
023import java.util.logging.Logger;
024
025import com.github.ricksbrown.cowsay.Cowsay;
026import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActionResult;
027import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorSystem;
028import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Interpreter;
029import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Vertex;
030
031/**
032 * Level 3 wrapper that adds workflow capabilities to a Node POJO.
033 *
034 * <p>This class extends {@link Interpreter} to provide workflow execution
035 * capabilities while delegating SSH operations to a wrapped {@link Node} instance.</p>
036 *
037 * <p>This demonstrates the three-level architecture of actor-IaC:</p>
038 * <ul>
039 * <li><strong>Level 1 (POJO):</strong> {@link Node} - pure POJO with SSH functionality</li>
040 * <li><strong>Level 2 (Actor):</strong> ActorRef&lt;Node&gt; - actor wrapper for concurrent execution</li>
041 * <li><strong>Level 3 (Workflow):</strong> NodeInterpreter - workflow capabilities + IIActorRef wrapper</li>
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <p><strong>Design principle:</strong> Node remains a pure POJO, independent of ActorSystem.
045 * NodeInterpreter wraps Node to add workflow capabilities without modifying the Node class.</p>
046 *
047 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
048 */
049public class NodeInterpreter extends Interpreter {
050
051    private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(NodeInterpreter.class.getName());
052
053    /**
054     * The wrapped Node POJO that handles actual SSH operations.
055     */
056    private final Node node;
057
058    /**
059     * The overlay directory path for YAML overlay feature.
060     */
061    private String overlayDir;
062
063    /**
064     * The current vertex YAML snippet (first 10 lines) for accumulator reporting.
065     */
066    private String currentVertexYaml = "";
067
068    /**
069     * Constructs a NodeInterpreter that wraps the specified Node.
070     *
071     * @param node the {@link Node} instance to wrap
072     * @param system the actor system for workflow execution
073     */
074    public NodeInterpreter(Node node, IIActorSystem system) {
075        super();
076        this.node = node;
077        this.system = system;
078        // Initialize parent's logger (used by Interpreter.runWorkflow error handling)
079        super.logger = logger;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Executes a command on the remote node via SSH.
084     *
085     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link Node#executeCommand(String)} method.</p>
086     *
087     * @param command the command to execute
088     * @return the result of the command execution
089     * @throws IOException if SSH connection fails
090     */
091    public Node.CommandResult executeCommand(String command) throws IOException {
092        return node.executeCommand(command);
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Executes a command with sudo privileges on the remote node.
097     *
098     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link Node#executeSudoCommand(String)} method.
099     * Requires SUDO_PASSWORD environment variable to be set.</p>
100     *
101     * @param command the command to execute with sudo
102     * @return the result of the command execution
103     * @throws IOException if SSH connection fails or SUDO_PASSWORD is not set
104     */
105    public Node.CommandResult executeSudoCommand(String command) throws IOException {
106        return node.executeSudoCommand(command);
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Gets the hostname of the node.
111     *
112     * @return the hostname
113     */
114    public String getHostname() {
115        return node.getHostname();
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * Gets the username for SSH connections.
120     *
121     * @return the username
122     */
123    public String getUser() {
124        return node.getUser();
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Gets the SSH port.
129     *
130     * @return the SSH port number
131     */
132    public int getPort() {
133        return node.getPort();
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * Gets the wrapped Node instance.
138     *
139     * <p>This allows direct access to the underlying POJO when needed.</p>
140     *
141     * @return the wrapped Node
142     */
143    public Node getNode() {
144        return node;
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Sets the overlay directory for YAML overlay feature.
149     *
150     * @param overlayDir the path to the overlay directory containing overlay-conf.yaml
151     */
152    public void setOverlayDir(String overlayDir) {
153        this.overlayDir = overlayDir;
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Gets the overlay directory path.
158     *
159     * @return the overlay directory path, or null if not set
160     */
161    public String getOverlayDir() {
162        return overlayDir;
163    }
164
165    /**
166     * Hook called when entering a vertex during workflow execution.
167     *
168     * <p>Displays the workflow name and first 10 lines of the vertex definition
169     * in YAML format using cowsay to provide visual separation between workflow steps.</p>
170     *
171     * @param vertex the vertex being entered
172     */
173    @Override
174    protected void onEnterVertex(Vertex vertex) {
175        // Get workflow name
176        String workflowName = (getCode() != null && getCode().getName() != null)
177                ? getCode().getName()
178                : "unknown-workflow";
179
180        // Get YAML-formatted output (first 10 lines)
181        String yamlText = vertex.toYamlString(10).trim();
182        this.currentVertexYaml = yamlText;
183
184        // Combine workflow name and vertex YAML
185        String displayText = "[" + workflowName + "]\n" + yamlText;
186        String[] cowsayArgs = { displayText };
187        System.out.println(Cowsay.say(cowsayArgs));
188    }
189
190    /**
191     * Returns the current vertex YAML snippet for accumulator reporting.
192     *
193     * @return the first 10 lines of the current vertex in YAML format
194     */
195    public String getCurrentVertexYaml() {
196        return currentVertexYaml;
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Loads and runs a workflow file to completion with overlay support.
201     *
202     * <p>If overlayDir is set, the workflow is loaded with overlay applied.
203     * Variables defined in overlay-conf.yaml are substituted before execution.</p>
204     *
205     * @param workflowFile the workflow file path (YAML or JSON)
206     * @param maxIterations maximum number of state transitions allowed
207     * @return ActionResult with success=true if completed, false otherwise
208     */
209    @Override
210    public ActionResult runWorkflow(String workflowFile, int maxIterations) {
211        // If no overlay is set, use parent implementation
212        if (overlayDir == null) {
213            return super.runWorkflow(workflowFile, maxIterations);
214        }
215
216        try {
217            // Reset state for fresh execution
218            reset();
219
220            // Resolve workflow file path
221            Path workflowPath;
222            if (workflowBaseDir != null) {
223                workflowPath = Path.of(workflowBaseDir, workflowFile);
224            } else {
225                workflowPath = Path.of(workflowFile);
226            }
227
228            // Load workflow with overlay applied
229            Path overlayPath = Path.of(overlayDir);
230            readYaml(workflowPath, overlayPath);
231
232            // Run until end
233            return runUntilEnd(maxIterations);
234
235        } catch (Exception e) {
236            logger.log(Level.SEVERE, "Error running workflow with overlay: " + workflowFile, e);
237            return new ActionResult(false, "Error: " + e.getMessage());
238        }
239    }
240}
